I. Introduction to Statistics
- Definition of statistics
- Importance of statistics in research and decision-making
- Types of data: qualitative and quantitative
- Levels of measurement: nominal, ordinal, interval, and ratio

II. Descriptive Statistics
- Measures of central tendency: mean, median, mode
- Measures of variability: range, variance, standard deviation
- Frequency distributions and histograms
- Graphical representation of data: bar graphs, pie charts, scatter plots

III. Probability
- Basic concepts of probability: sample space, events, outcomes
- Laws of probability: addition rule, multiplication rule
- Conditional probability
- Probability distributions: discrete and continuous

IV. Sampling and Sampling Distributions
- Types of sampling: random, stratified, cluster, systematic
- Sampling error and bias
- Central Limit Theorem
- Sampling distributions: mean, proportion

V. Estimation
- Point estimation: sample mean, sample proportion
- Confidence intervals: interpretation and construction
- Margin of error
- Factors affecting the width of confidence intervals

VI. Hypothesis Testing
- Null and alternative hypotheses
- Type I and Type II errors
- Test statistic and p-value
- One-sample, two-sample, and paired t-tests
- Chi-square test for independence

VII. Correlation and Regression Analysis
- Scatter plots and correlation coefficient
- Simple linear regression
- Interpretation of regression equation
- Residual analysis

VIII. Inferential Statistics
- Parametric vs. nonparametric tests
- Analysis of variance (ANOVA)
- Nonparametric tests: Mann-Whitney U test, Wilcoxon signed-rank test
- Power and sample size calculations

IX. Data Analysis with Statistical Software
- Introduction to statistical software (e.g., SPSS, R)
- Importing and cleaning data
- Descriptive statistics and graphical representation
- Performing hypothesis tests and regression analysis

X. Ethical Considerations in Statistics
- Confidentiality and anonymity
- Informed consent
- Data manipulation and fraudulent practices
- Reporting and interpreting statistical results accurately

XI. Applications of Statistics
- Business and finance
- Healthcare and medicine
- Social sciences and psychology
- Market research and surveys
- Quality control and process improvement

XII. Tips for Successful Data Analysis
- Plan and design your study carefully
- Ensure data quality and accuracy
- Choose appropriate statistical methods
- Interpret and communicate results effectively
- Continuously update and enhance statistical skills
